issue.title: Umlauts from German Language get replaced with their non-mutated counterparts (Ä->A, Ö->O, Ü->U) instead of following language standard.

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Issue is a bug

labels.name: Status: Needs Triage
labels.description: New Issue needing triage

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

When triggering a search for a German movie with Umlauts (Ä,Ö,Ü) i can observe that it replaces the Umlauts with their regular counterparts.

Example: 

Actual Name: _Drachenzähmen leicht gemacht_ (taken from tmdb) https://www.themoviedb.org/movie/10191-how-to-train-your-dragon/translations#de-DE
In the request it looks for : _Drachenzahmen leicht gemacht_

> 2023-10-13 07:11:27.4|Trace|HttpClient|Res: HTTP/1.1 [GET] https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=Drachenzahmen%20leicht%20gemacht%203%20Die%20geheime%20Welt%202019: 200.OK (669 bytes) (149 ms)

This leads to no results being found on the indexer.

### Expected Behavior

Umlauts should be replaced like common in German language:

Ä->AE, Ö->OE, Ü-> UE

So the request should look like this: _Drachenzaehmen leicht gemacht_

> 2023-10-13 07:11:27.4|Trace|HttpClient|Res: HTTP/1.1 [GET] https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=Drachenzaehmen%20leicht%20gemacht%203%20Die%20geheime%20Welt%202019: 200.OK (669 bytes) (149 ms)

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create a Custom Format which wants German language
2. Add a movie like "How to tame your dragon" which has Umlauts in the german title
3. Trigger a search and observe the trace logs

### Environment

```markdown
- OS:
- Radarr: 5.0.3.8127
- Docker Install: Yes
- Using Reverse Proxy: No
- Browser: All
- Database: Sqlite 3.41.2
```


### What branch are you running?

Master

### Trace Logs? **Not Optional**

```
2023-10-13 07:11:25.3|Info|ReleaseSearchService|Searching indexers for [How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World]. 1 active indexers
2023-10-13 07:11:25.3|Debug|Torznab|Downloading Feed https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=How%20to%20Train%20Your%20Dragon%20The%20Hidden%20World%202019
2023-10-13 07:11:25.3|Trace|HttpClient|Req: [GET] https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=How%20to%20Train%20Your%20Dragon%20The%20Hidden%20World%202019
2023-10-13 07:11:25.3|Trace|ConfigService|Using default config value for 'proxyenabled' defaultValue:'False'
2023-10-13 07:11:25.8|Trace|HttpClient|Res: HTTP/1.1 [GET] https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=How%20to%20Train%20Your%20Dragon%20The%20Hidden%20World%202019: 200.OK (669 bytes) (537 ms)
2023-10-13 07:11:25.8|Debug|Torznab|Downloading Feed https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=Drachenzahmen%20leicht%20gemacht%203%20Die%20geheime%20Welt%202019
2023-10-13 07:11:25.8|Trace|RateLimitService|Rate Limit triggered, delaying 'tntracker.org' for 1.460 sec
2023-10-13 07:11:27.3|Trace|HttpClient|Req: [GET] https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=Drachenzahmen%20leicht%20gemacht%203%20Die%20geheime%20Welt%202019
2023-10-13 07:11:27.3|Trace|ConfigService|Using default config value for 'proxyenabled' defaultValue:'False'
2023-10-13 07:11:27.4|Trace|HttpClient|Res: HTTP/1.1 [GET] https://tntracker.org/api/torznab/api?t=search&cat=2000,2040&extended=1&apikey=(removed)&offset=0&limit=100&q=Drachenzahmen%20leicht%20gemacht%203%20Die%20geheime%20Welt%202019: 200.OK (669 bytes) (149 ms)
2023-10-13 07:11:27.4|Debug|ReleaseSearchService|Total of 0 reports were found for [How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World] from 1 indexers
2023-10-13 07:11:27.4|Info|DownloadDecisionMaker|No results found
2023-10-13 07:11:27.4|Trace|Http|Res: 5801 [GET] /api/v3/release?movieId=705: 200.OK (2170 ms)
2023-10-13 07:11:27.4|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/release?movieId=705: 200.OK (2170 ms)
```

### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports will be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have read and followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs - the logs contain `trace` - that are relevant and show this issue.

comment.body:
After digging into the code myself i found that in file _Radarr/src/NzbDrone.Core/Parser/Parser.cs_ some mapping to the correct representation for german umlauts its happening. 

As far as i see this is only implemented for newznab and not for torznab as it looks like.

issue.title: Loading mutiple movies in tabs is super slow

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Issue is a bug

labels.name: Area: Database
labels.description: Issue is related to the database

labels.name: Type: Enhancement
labels.description: Current situation is suboptimal and could use improvement.

labels.name: Status: Needs Triage
labels.description: New Issue needing triage

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

If I open multiple tabs with movies (so I can go tab by tab and edit or search for a movie manually), the cpu usage of Radarr shoots up and tab loads can take 20-45 seconds to complete.

The tab urls would be something like: `/movie/2357`

The offending API calls seem to be `/api/v3/movie` and `/api/v3/collection`

```
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Trace|Http|Res: 17463 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21667 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21667 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Trace|Http|Res: 17486 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21308 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21308 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Trace|Http|Res: 17476 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21629 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21629 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Trace|Http|Res: 17516 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20093 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20093 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Trace|Http|Res: 17500 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20811 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20811 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.4|Trace|Http|Res: 17531 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (19798 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.4|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (19798 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.6|Trace|Http|Res: 17546 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (18506 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.6|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (18506 ms)
```

This is even slow on a single movie or radarr index page load. (2-4 seconds here)

![slow](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/assets/171158/468e36af-80e3-4582-82ee-139535e39cf0)


### Expected Behavior

Smooth sub second page loads.

### Steps To Reproduce

Open Radarr index page.  
Middle click 5-10 (or more for delay and load failures) movies into new tabs.


### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Ubuntu-23.04
- Radarr: 5.0.2.8103
- Docker Install: No
- Using Reverse Proxy: Caddy V2 
- Browser: Firefox
- Database: Sqlite3 and Postgres (both perform roughly the same with this bug)
```


### What branch are you running?

Develop

### Trace Logs? **Not Optional**

Attached logs

[radarr.debug.txt](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/files/12775737/radarr.debug.txt)
[radarr.trace.txt](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/files/12775738/radarr.trace.txt)


### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports will be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have read and followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs - the logs contain `trace` - that are relevant and show this issue.

comment.body:
> was adjusted to use them then all slowness issues would go away.

PRs welcome.

issue.title: Loading mutiple movies in tabs is super slow

labels.name: Type: Bug
labels.description: Issue is a bug

labels.name: Area: Database
labels.description: Issue is related to the database

labels.name: Type: Enhancement
labels.description: Current situation is suboptimal and could use improvement.

labels.name: Status: Needs Triage
labels.description: New Issue needing triage

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

If I open multiple tabs with movies (so I can go tab by tab and edit or search for a movie manually), the cpu usage of Radarr shoots up and tab loads can take 20-45 seconds to complete.

The tab urls would be something like: `/movie/2357`

The offending API calls seem to be `/api/v3/movie` and `/api/v3/collection`

```
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Trace|Http|Res: 17463 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21667 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21667 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Trace|Http|Res: 17486 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21308 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.1|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21308 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Trace|Http|Res: 17476 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21629 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (21629 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Trace|Http|Res: 17516 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20093 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20093 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Trace|Http|Res: 17500 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20811 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.2|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (20811 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.4|Trace|Http|Res: 17531 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (19798 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.4|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (19798 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.6|Trace|Http|Res: 17546 [GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (18506 ms)
2023-09-30 01:16:29.6|Debug|Api|[GET] /api/v3/movie: 200.OK (18506 ms)
```

This is even slow on a single movie or radarr index page load. (2-4 seconds here)

![slow](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/assets/171158/468e36af-80e3-4582-82ee-139535e39cf0)


### Expected Behavior

Smooth sub second page loads.

### Steps To Reproduce

Open Radarr index page.  
Middle click 5-10 (or more for delay and load failures) movies into new tabs.


### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Ubuntu-23.04
- Radarr: 5.0.2.8103
- Docker Install: No
- Using Reverse Proxy: Caddy V2 
- Browser: Firefox
- Database: Sqlite3 and Postgres (both perform roughly the same with this bug)
```


### What branch are you running?

Develop

### Trace Logs? **Not Optional**

Attached logs

[radarr.debug.txt](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/files/12775737/radarr.debug.txt)
[radarr.trace.txt](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/files/12775738/radarr.trace.txt)


### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports will be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have read and followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs - the logs contain `trace` - that are relevant and show this issue.

comment.body:
Radarr is slow because the entire movie library is transferred from the server to the browser on every page load. It could be much faster if movie searches and filters was done server-side on demand rather than all in the browser (client-side). Even the movie list page would load faster, assuming default filters are in place.
Most web applications rely on server-side for searches, filters, etc. When loading Amazon, it doesn't download all products to the browser then rely on browser client-side code to filter and query. It's all done server-side. If Radarr followed this practice all pages would load nearly instantly every time.
When any Radarr page loads it loads the full movie library twice from two different API methods (/api/v3/movie and /api/v3/collection). If both of these API methods were changed to accepted a filter querystring and the frontend was adjusted to use them then all slowness issues would go away.

issue.title: Radarr sometimes moves files instead of using hard links

labels.name: Type: Support
labels.description: Issue is a support request. Bot will auto close and give a message.

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

Radarr is moving the movie file instead of using hardlinks
`2023-08-27 21:58:54.2|Trace|DiskProvider|Moved '/home/(removed)/media/downloads/Puss in Boots (2011) (2160p BluRay x265 HEVC 10bit HDR AAC 7.1 Tigole)/Puss in Boots (2011) (2160p BluRay x265 10bit HDR Tigole).mkv' -> '/movies/Puss in Boots (2011)/Puss in Boots - 2011.mkv' using Syscall.rename`

This only happens sometimes, and all my files are in the same path, I can't understand the pattern

### Expected Behavior

Radarr would use a hardline and leave the original files intact

### Steps To Reproduce

Media Management:
- Rename Movies [X]
- Replace Ilegal Characters [X]
- Create empty movie folders [X]
- Delete empty movie folders [ ]
- Skip free space check [X]
- **Use hardlinks instead of copy** [X]
- Import using script [ ]
- import extra files:`.sub, .nfo, .srt`
- Unmonitored deleted movies [X]
- Analyse video files [X]
- Rescan movies after refresh: `Always`
- No recycle bin path configured
- Set Permissions [ ]

1. Add a movie to the download client
2. Radarr imports movie
3. Most of the times it moves the files instead of using hardlinks

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Arch Linux
- Radarr: Radarr 4.6.4.7568
- Docker Install: No
- Using Reverse Proxy: Yes [10.2.128.79]
- Browser: 
- Database: Sqlite 3.42.0
```


### What branch are you running?

Master

### Trace Logs? **Not Optional**

[radarr.trace.txt](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/files/12448898/radarr.trace.txt)


### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports will be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have read and followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs - the logs contain `trace` - that are relevant and show this issue.

comment.body:
Please use [Discord](https://radarr.video/discord) for support/questions.

GitHub is not for support. This is not a bug and is just about always an issue with the user's setup or environment

comment.body:
I have the same issue. I've recently used rmlint to find replace all duplicates by hardlinks to save some space.
I'm also using Lidarr, but only Radarr can't create hardlinks.

issue.title: Movie release year missing in folder name but not file name

labels.name: Type: Support
labels.description: Issue is a support request. Bot will auto close and give a message.

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

I have multiple movies, like "The Croods" and "Forest Gump", which after importing never have a release date in their folder name, but do in the file name. I tried reimporting multiple times but they still always end up like that.

For example:
"\Shows\Movies\Forrest Gump\Forrest Gump (1994) - Bluray-1080p.mkv"
""\Shows\Movies\The Croods\The Croods (2013) - Bluray-1080p.mkv"

### Expected Behavior

Both movies containing the year also in the folder name, not just the file name.
When on the site of the movie in radarr, it also shows the path as being "/movies/Forrest Gump" without the year.
Why is this? Is this expected behaviour?

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Manually import Forrest Gump or The Croods
2. See a folder being created without a year, but the file being renamed to contain the year, despite the naming settings specifiying to include the year in the folder name.

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Linux on a Synology NAS 920+
- Radarr: 5.0.3.8127
- Docker Install: Yes
- Using Reverse Proxy: Yes, Nginx Proxy Manager
- Browser: Firefox
- Database: Sqlite 3.41.2
```


### What branch are you running?

Master

### Trace Logs? **Not Optional**

My standard movie format is "{Movie Title} ({Release Year}) - {Quality Full}" and my standard folder format is "{Movie Title} ({Release Year})".
[trace_log.txt](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/files/13167581/trace_log.txt)
![forrest_gump](https://github.com/Radarr/Radarr/assets/43169119/ed5b2972-3de1-45b1-8bb1-7867f19402b8)


### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports will be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have read and followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs - the logs contain `trace` - that are relevant and show this issue.

issue.title: Postgres migration didnt work

labels.name: Type: Support
labels.description: Issue is a support request. Bot will auto close and give a message.

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing open and closed issues

### Current Behavior

Following directions on #7269 and in the [wiki](https://wiki.servarr.com/radarr/postgres-setup), I attempted to migrate my database to Postgres and received the following series of errors. I tried asking in the [Discord](https://discord.com/channels/264387956343570434/264388019585286144/1166406191170191441) but didnt receive a response...

```
KABOOM!
SIMPLE-ERROR: pgloader failed to find anything in schema "public" in target catalog.
An unhandled error condition has been signalled:
   pgloader failed to find anything in schema "public" in target catalog.




What I am doing here?

pgloader failed to find anything in schema "public" in target catalog.
```

Help please!

### Expected Behavior

Successful Postgres migration.

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: Debian Bullseye
- Radarr: :latest
- Docker Install: 24.0.6 
- Using Reverse Proxy: No
- Browser: N/A
- Database: SQLite at the moment....
```


### What branch are you running?

Nightly

### Trace Logs? **Not Optional**

See above

### Trace Logs have been provided as applicable. Reports will be closed if the required logs are not provided.

- [X] I have read and followed the steps in the wiki link above and provided the required trace logs - the logs contain `trace` - that are relevant and show this issue.

comment.body: Thanks @Qstick - now that I've dropped/recreated the dbs and launched/shutdown Radarr to populate the shells, I've rerun the pgloader command and received a [load of warnings/errors](https://gist.github.com/barbequesauce/e71442ec20da90b2c400b2fc71d56289). Any thoughts?
